function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Assuming a given physical space and constraints based on basic mathematical shapes may not accurately reflect the complexities of a built environment.","Impact":"Inaccurate modeling may lead to ineffective disease propagation mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive spatial analysis and consider additional design constraints to more accurately represent the built environment.","Technologies":"Spatial analysis software, 3D modeling tools","People":"Architects, urban planners, designers","Owner":"Architectural firms, urban planning agencies"},{"Description":"Stricter social distancing requirements may not be the only constraints to consider in the design of built environments for disease propagation mitigation.","Impact":"Neglecting other practical constraints may result in impractical design solutions.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough practical significance analysis to identify and incorporate other relevant constraints into the design process.","Technologies":"Simulation software, optimization algorithms","People":"Designers, engineers, architects","Owner":"Design firms, engineering companies, architectural agencies"},{"Description":"Feasible solutions for seating arrangements may not always be practical due to additional practical considerations such as space for food trolleys.","Impact":"Inadequate consideration of practical needs may lead to unfeasible design solutions for disease propagation mitigation.","Mitigation":"Incorporate practical considerations, such as space for food trolleys, into the seating arrangement design process.","Technologies":"Space optimization software, scenario testing tools","People":"Aircraft interior designers, airline planners","Owner":"Aircraft design firms, airline companies"}]}
